title: spec: is not explicit that operators apply to named types.
body:
The "Type declarations" section says,

The declared type does not inherit any methods bound to the existing type, but the
method set of an interface type or of elements of a composite type remains unchanged:

but it does not say that, for example, after type A int that the numerical operators
like + and / apply to A.

It's not a language change, just a missing piece of precision in the spec.
